intro: Cunila incana, commonly known as hoary cunila, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely hairy, gray-green foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along roadsides. Cunila incana is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
